title: (x) Swiss International Air Lines logo sans - CH Sans (custom face) {Rainer}
content:
does anybody knows wath corporate font is used for swiss

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307193321im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_swiss_5345.gif)
author: xyz.ch

comments.content:
Here’s a bigger image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307193321im_/http:/typophile.com/files/swiss_6059.jpg)

Reminds me of Univers, but it’s not.
[Swiss uses its proprietary typeface CH Sans, designed by Freda Sack at Foundry Types"](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307193321/http:/users.ncrvnet.nl/mstol/swiss.html).

Seems like an odd proportion in the red rectangle for the Swiss. I would have expected either a square or a route2 proportion. This nearly square seems out of character. I wonder how thwy chose it?

ChrisL

thank you verrrrrry much Renko  
... that was realy quick

AlexM

thank you verrrrrry much Renko  
... that was realy quick

AlexM

@Chris: I mucked about with the logo in Illustrator and there is no system to this thing at all. The squares have a 7:8 ratio, the whole something like 2 to not quite 1.  
But this may be something to be expected: swiss is what became of Swissair after their bankrupcy. Somebody probably slapped this together in a hurry. ; )

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

PS Swissair had a really tight identity… Too bad.

Thanks, Bert!  
Yes, Swissair was one of the first airlines with a solid identity.

ChrisL

As you may know, the re-branding was done by Tyler Brûlé and his Wink agency. You'll find some limited information (including a specimen of CH Sans) on the company portfolio site at [http://winkorp.com/portfolio/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150307193321/http:/winkorp.com/portfolio/index.html "http://winkorp.com/portfolio/index.html")  
Because it's a flash site you'll have to navigate to Branding \> Swiss Intl Air Lines \> Typography.

Mark
